TopicTitle: Paper Space Program 1.8 (KSP Rocket Parts papercraft)

Articles.Content: I can't glue those small triangle parts onto the tops of the parts. How are you supposed to do it?

I can't glue those small triangle parts onto the tops of the parts. How are you supposed to do it?

Which triangles ?
The small ones that you have to cut out in order to be able to curve the part then use to stick it onto the top piece.

The small ones that you have to cut out in order to be able to curve the part then use to stick it onto the top piece.

These are the flaps . You use them to glue to the parts together I think you should take a look at this tutorial
Oh thanks!, I would give you rep but it says i have to spread it around first.

Oh thanks!, I would give you rep but it says i have to spread it around first.

You're welcome

You're welcome

Never too much rep!

I'm a little confused. I want to try making some of these, but I can't find out if they're all the same size now... Are they? If not, can you please try to update it? Thanks. Awesome work here, and I can't wait to try it.

I'm a little confused. I want to try making some of these, but I can't find out if they're all the same size now... Are they? If not, can you please try to update it? Thanks. Awesome work here, and I can't wait to try it.

All the parts are the same size if you print them separately , but some of the older images have a bit bigger size than the new ones , so if you will copy and paste any part from any image to another their sizes might depend . Hope i've answered your question

Amazing! Will try to make some... i have not done papercraft in years!

Cheers!
I have no idea how it works but I gave you a rep This is amazing!
If only I was good with papercrafts.

I'd like to combine a solid fuel booster with a firework
Dude, I am so doing that for this new year!
OMG , you must make a video

So its about time to start this project... but there's a bit of a problem. SRBs are flat on the top and real life has, you know, FAR (it would probably flip over in a second). I was thinking about a Rockomax rocket stack, maybe something like this:

Printing it out in the max possible size my printer can handle and lining the interior with cardbord should help with stability, but I'm not sure how to prevent flipping in flight.

What do you guys think?

EDIT: It seems the max diameter I can print the 2,5m parts at is about 8cm. Not all that huge but not small either. And yes I have absolutley no idea on how to put a firework into a mainsail engine haha

Edited December 19, 2014 by MoffKalast

So its about time to start this project... but there's a bit of a problem. SRBs are flat on the top and real life has, you know, FAR (it would probably flip over in a second). I was thinking about a Rockomax rocket stack, maybe something like this:

http://i.imgur.com/j2nlptO.png

Printing it out in the max possible size my printer can handle and lining the interior with cardbord should help with stability, but I'm not sure how to prevent flipping in flight.

What do you guys think?

EDIT: It seems the max diameter I can print the 2,5m parts at is about 8cm. Not all that huge but not small either. And yes I have absolutley no idea on how to put a firework into a mainsail engine haha

Lol , i hope you'll come up with some ideas

Hello.

So I just stumbled over this thread and went through it, and I must say, you did some amazing work here arc5555. Thanks for keeping this alive for others and regularly updating.

So I was planning on building one of these myself. Upond reading through this thread someone stumbled over a problem with different image sizings. You mention that in the top post too. Now I understand, that these images are different sizes. But what I don't get is, what the correct scaling is. Are these all in-scale to each other, so if I copy a part from one thing to another, they are in scale? Or are they all scaled to the paper size?

Thanks,

PistonMiner.

Hello ! All the images are scaled to the paper size , and yes , if you'll copy a part from one image to another you might get some problems with the scale . I'll try to fix that on holidays + add the new parts

Hello ! All the images are scaled to the paper size , and yes , if you'll copy a part from one image to another you might get some problems with the scale . I'll try to fix that on holidays + add the new parts

Many thanks.
Update: I kinda pulled myself into making a model of Endurance from Interstellar so I'll probably postpone this project. Still hope to get it done though.

Ho-Ho-Ho ! Here comes the new update

For this update i've resized all the templates + added the brand new Mk3 parts

Download: <Link>

P.S. Happy Holidays

Could you make the parts from the Tantares mod?(http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/81537-0-90-Tantares-Stockalike-Soyuz-and-MIR-13-2-Crew-1-25m-Pod-Fuji-Release%21) They're pretty cool and fit in well with stock aesthetics.

Could you make the parts from the Tantares mod?(http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/81537-0-90-Tantares-Stockalike-Soyuz-and-MIR-13-2-Crew-1-25m-Pod-Fuji-Release%21) They're pretty cool and fit in well with stock aesthetics.

Oh wow , the mod looks pretty cool I'll try to make some parts

Oh wow , the mod looks pretty cool I'll try to make some parts

Yay! I can't wait.

Hi, I really love what you are doing here.

Sadly, I totally suck at pepakura paperworks (tried Halo Props some time ago) I get crazy from all the cutting and fiddling.

Luckly, I've got a 3D printer!

I totally love making models and props, especially from KSP and I modelled a high res model of the LV-30 and the basic jet engine some time ago and printed them, they came out awesome!

To cut to the point, it would take a sh*tload of time to model all of my favourite parts from KSP from blurry pics from the internet, which is time i sadly dont have.

I tried NinjaRipper but it doesnt seem to quite work and since you already have so many parts ripped, you must have some 3d model files laying around right? could you please post some 3d files somewhere and give me the download link? (only 3d models please, no color textures)

I hope to hear from you soon,

Kind Regards,

D de Waard

Hi,

Here I am again,

Thanks for taking the time but most of the files don't show the models. only 2 of the files actually showed the 3d models, the others just showed 2 stacks of triangles with space in between what i think is the VAB? and further on nothing.

You numbered the folders 0.1-0.8 and 1.0 and the files in the folders a.3DS b.3DS c.3DS and so on, only 0.1 a.3DS and b.3DS showed models, among which were the mk1 commandpod, poodle engine, mainsail and some fueltanks and adapters.

If you have the time, could you please take a closer look?

Thanks.

(opened in sketchup)
